channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The workplace needs to be designed like an ‘experience,’ says Gensler’s Ray Yuen, as employees resist the return to office
item.description: Employees don't want to return to the office. That poses a challenge for workplace designers like Yuen.

item.title: AI Is About To Destroy Tech Like Amazon Destroyed Retail
item.description: To see how the tech industry will decline, keep an eye on the “TikTok Wave” of eCommerce.

item.title: iPhone 17 resellers are seeing ‘bulk quantities’ traded in
item.description: While the iPhone 17 is expected to be one of the hottest gifts this holiday season, some of the early adopters of Apple’s latest phone may be moving o...

item.title: The Stock Market Keeps Shrugging Off Every Obstacle
item.description: The S&P 500 remains near record highs despite noisy economic data and political headlines.

item.title: Nintendo’s 98% staff retention rate means the average employee has been there 15 years
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Treasury Secretary Bessent insists Trump’s tariff agenda is ‘permanent,’ saying the White House can recreate it even with a Supreme Court loss
item.description: Using various other justifications, the White House can implement its tariffs regardless of a Supreme Court loss, said Bessent.

item.title: Columbia’s new Star Wars drop walks thin line between cosplay and clothing
item.description: Columbia Sportswear just lauched its Endor collection , and I want it all. Inspired by the clothes worn by the rebel squad that took on the Death Star...

item.title: The Great Fruit of the Loom Logo Mystery Is Solved
item.description: Did the Fruit of the Loom logo ever have a cornucopia in it? Or is your brain tricking you?

item.title: Bill Gates Says This Book Taught Him How to Age Happily
item.description: The Microsoft co-founder’s annual year-end book recommendations contained a novel that teaches an essential (and science backed) truth about aging wel...

item.title: The Phoenix Mercury rebrands for a world where the WNBA is bigger than ever
item.description: The Phoenix Mercury rebranded for the first time in team history, and the new look is part of a wider trend across the WNBA as teams modernize their l...

item.title: How a Texas gas producer plans to exploit the ‘mega trend’ of power plants for AI hyperscalers
item.description: BKV is growing both its shale gas and power generation footprints to attract AI data center campuses.

item.title: Before running the world’s most valuable company, Jensen Huang was a 9-year-old janitor in Kentucky
item.description: “It’s hard not to love this country," Huang said. "It’s hard not to be romantic about this country.”

item.title: The difference between genuine authenticity and performed authenticity means everything
item.description: Authenticity is currency. You can spend it recklessly and go broke, or invest it strategically and build wealth. Most leaders are choosing bankruptcy ...

item.title: The unexpected winner of the AI data center boom
item.description: The data center boom is fully underway, and the numbers are staggering: billions of dollars in costs, millions of square feet worth of buildings, giga...

item.title: A Polymarket User Just Made $1 Million in Less Than 24 Hours. Was it Inside Information?
item.description: The event raises questions about how prediction markets are regulated.
